info.title: Workflows Executions
info.description: Service for Workflow Executions which covers executions of processes defined in an Organization

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description: Interact with workflow executions - start / close / retrieve one or all / search / delete

get.description: Retrieve Workflow Executions. Optionally, you can filter them by context & schema. Please be aware, these executions are more light weight - steps are not loaded with all information.

200.description: Success - executions loaded with success. Empty array if org has no executions.

dueDate.description: Due date for finishing the workflow

lastModifiedBy.description: Id of the user who closed workflow

enableECPWorkflow.description: Indicates whether this workflow is available for End Customer Portal or not. By default it's not.

anyOf.description: A group of Steps that define the progress of the Workflow

ecp.description: Details regarding ECP for the workflow step
Details regarding ECP for the workflow step

post.description: Create a Workflow Execution. Start a new workflow execution, based on a workflow definition (template).

201.description: Success - if the execution is created successfully

dueDate.description: Due date for finishing the workflow

lastModifiedBy.description: Id of the user who closed workflow

enableECPWorkflow.description: Indicates whether this workflow is available for End Customer Portal or not. By default it's not.

anyOf.description: A group of Steps that define the progress of the Workflow

ecp.description: Details regarding ECP for the workflow step
Details regarding ECP for the workflow step

steps.name: Call client and confirm address and product
Send email confirming contact with the client

get.description: Get a full workflow execution, included steps information, by execution id.

200.description: Success - execution loaded with success. Empty response execution was not found.

dueDate.description: Due date for finishing the workflow

lastModifiedBy.description: Id of the user who closed workflow

enableECPWorkflow.description: Indicates whether this workflow is available for End Customer Portal or not. By default it's not.

anyOf.description: A group of Steps that define the progress of the Workflow

ecp.description: Details regarding ECP for the workflow step
Details regarding ECP for the workflow step

steps.name: Call client and confirm address and product
Send email confirming contact with the client

patch.description: Patches updates like assignees, status, closingReason for a single Workflow Execution.

requestBody.description: Patch Updates for Workflow Execution payload.

delete.description: Delete workflow execution by id. Workflow contexts will NOT be deleted.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Id of the execution to de deleted.

204.description: Success - if the execution was deleted successfully

post.description: Create a new step in current workflow execution.

201.description: Success - if the step is created with success

ecp.description: Details regarding ECP for the workflow step

patch.description: Patches various changes to a workflow execution step.

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: Short uuid (length 6) to identify the Workflow Execution Step.

200.description: Success - if the step is updated successfully

ecp.description: Details regarding ECP for the workflow step

delete.description: Deletes a step from a workflow execution.

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: Short uuid (length 6) to identify the Workflow Execution Step.

post.description: Search Workflow Executions by different filters.

get.description:
Shows all Closing Reasons defined at the moment of starting the Workflow Execution.
The Closing Reasons shown in the execution are just snapshots
from the state of the Definition when the instance was created.

200.description: returns all Closing Reasons for this Execution
